name:
Oh look, the stupid hot takes on the Apple Vision Pro have already started, only a few hours after the keynote wrapped.

Take a beat, folks. Reflect a little before dumping on it. I saw one guy say that the “rich people” that buy it should “be ridiculed.” So dumb.

content.html:

content.value:

summary: @cleverdevil couldn’t agree more. A decade in the making, three hours to get virtually destroyed. So dumb.

content.html: @cleverdevil couldn’t agree more. A decade in the making, three hours to get virtually destroyed. So dumb.
content.value: @cleverdevil couldn’t agree more. A decade in the making, three hours to get virtually destroyed. So dumb.

summary:
@jonathan I’m not totally sold but also not totally critical.
The possibilities with AR are incredible, and this is the most reasonable step in that direction anyone has done thus far. I do find it odd that the big sell is "Using your computer in AR" rather than use-cases that can only ever work in AR
